meanings.definition: To supply with material or fuel.
meanings.sent1: The farmer will infeed the animals with hay.
meanings.sent2: The workers infeed the machine with raw materials.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally infeeded too much salt into the soup.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness infeeds positivity into our team.
meanings.sent5: Infeeding the firewood into the fireplace kept the room warm.

meanings.definition: The act of supplying material or fuel.
meanings.sent1: The infeed of resources is crucial for the project's success.
meanings.sent2: The constant infeed of data helps improve the system.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected infeed of customers caused a rush at the store.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a continuous infeed of joy into our lives.
meanings.sent5: The infeed of donations made a significant impact on the charity's work.

meanings.definition: A stream of material or fuel supplied.
meanings.sent1: The conveyor belt carried the infeed of coal to the furnace.
meanings.sent2: The steady infeed of water kept the turbine running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The sudden infeed of orders overwhelmed the small business.
meanings.sent4: His words were an infeed of inspiration to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The infeed of sunlight through the window brightened up the room.
